holidays.name: National Cat Day
holidays.description: A purr-fect day to celebrate our feline friends and promote cat adoption! Cat lovers shower their kitties with love, treats, and toys.
holidays.origin: Created in 2005 by the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (ASPCA) to raise awareness about cat adoption and welfare.
holidays.funFact: Cats have been considered sacred in many cultures, and on this day, some people even share photos of their cats dressed in costumes or enjoying special meals!

holidays.name: Internet Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the invention of the internet and its impact on our lives, connecting people and information across the globe.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the first message sent over ARPANET, the precursor to the internet, on October 29, 1969.
holidays.funFact: The first message sent was supposed to be 'LOGIN' but the system crashed after just 'LO' – the early internet sure had funny glitches!

holidays.name: Oatmeal Day
holidays.description: A cozy food day dedicated to enjoying warm bowls of oatmeal in all its forms, from sweet to savory.
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday celebrated by oatmeal lovers to promote the health benefits and comfort of this humble grain.
holidays.funFact: Oatmeal was historically considered a poor man's food but is now a trendy superfood featured in everything from beauty products to craft beers!

holidays.name: Frankenstein Day
holidays.description: Celebrates the iconic fictional scientist Dr. Victor Frankenstein and Mary Shelley's groundbreaking novel 'Frankenstein,' published in 1818.
holidays.origin: Commemorates Mary Shelley's birthday on October 29, 1797, honoring her contribution to gothic horror and science fiction genres.
holidays.funFact: Mary Shelley wrote 'Frankenstein' when she was just 18 years old during a famous ghost storytelling contest with her friends, including Lord Byron.
